definition: the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
old variant of 拿[na2]
variant of 拿[na2]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: This article to "brings the principle" a word proverb newly to say.
sentences.chinese: 本文对“拿来主义”一词老话新说。

sentences.english: In regards to foreign popular culture, I always take it and use it.
sentences.chinese: 始终是用拿来主义的态度接受的。

definition: to copy/to imitate
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to copy word for word
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
"learn from the foreigners in order to gain command of them", idea advocated by Wei Yuan 魏源[Wei4 Yuan2]
pinyin: shi1 yi2 chang2 ji4 yi3 zhi4 yi2

definition: lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as a model (idiom)/fig. to copy slavishly
to take the best/to absorb the essence
book worship/bookishness

market access in return for technology transfer (PRC policy since the 1980s which gives foreign companies access to China's domestic market in exchange for sharing their intellectual property, characterized by the US in the 2019 trade war as "forced technology transfer")
to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
